#XRP  Jumps 9% as Bitcoin Approaches $95,000 Level    $XRP  led the crypto rally Monday with a 9% gain to just below $2.32 after breaking key resistance overnight. The move represents the #strongest  performance since mid-November and outpaced gains across other major digital assets.   $BTC  rose to its highest level since mid-November, gaining more than 3% to $94,400 during Monday's trading session. The rally brought the asset closer to $95,000, a level analysts view as necessary to #gain  further momentum. The percentage advance was the largest in more than a month.   Crypto-related stocks posted sharp gains after experiencing sustained selling pressure in late 2025. Coinbase (COIN) received an upgrade to a Buy rating from Goldman Sachs earlier Monday and rose nearly 9%. Strategy (MSTR) and Robinhood (HOOD) gained 5% and 6%, respectively.   Smaller-cap stocks posted double-digit gains. Bakkt (BKKT) jumped 30% higher, while Figure (FIGR) added 20%. Bitcoin miner Hut 8 (HUT) climbed 15% Monday, nearly reaching $60 per share. The stock's split-adjusted 2021 record high of $76 may be within reach for longtime investors.   U.S. stocks also rose Monday, with the Dow advancing 1.4%. The #Nasdaq  and S&P 500 posted more modest gains of 0.7%. Precious metals remained volatile with an upward trend, as #silver  advanced 7% and gold 3%.   Lukman Otunuga, senior market analyst at FXTM, stated that $BTC  may be positioned for a comeback in 2026 after falling more than 6% in 2025. Falling interest rates and a thinning supply of actively traded $BTC  could create conditions for recovery, with long-term holders who are keeping coins off exchanges potentially tightening supply and supporting prices.
